light.translation[0].definitions[0].defi: the energy from the Sun, a flame, a lamp etc that allows you to see things
light.translation[0].definitions[0].exam: We saw a flash of light.
Everything looked grey in the dim light of the oil lamp.
I read by the light of the fire.
The man moved forward into the light.
light.translation[0].definitions[1].defi: a particular type of light, with its own particular colour, level of brightness etc
light.translation[0].definitions[1].exam: The colours look different in different lights.
light.translation[0].definitions[2].defi: something that produces light, especially electric light, to help you to see
light.translation[0].definitions[2].exam: Ahead of us we could see the lights of the city.
We’re having a mixture of wall lights and ceiling lights in different parts of the house.
Can you turn the light down (=make it less bright) a bit?
I switched on the light in the bedroom.
Don’t forget to switch the lights off when you go out.
Can you turn the light out downstairs?
The lights in the office were still on.
The street lights were just beginning to come on.
He left a light on in the kitchen.
Make sure all the lights are off when you leave.
Suddenly all the lights in the house went out.
light.translation[0].definitions[3].defi: something such as a lamp that you can carry to give you light
light.translation[0].definitions[3].exam: Shine a light over here, will you?
light.translation[0].definitions[4].defi: one of a set of red, green, and yellow lights used for controlling traffic
light.translation[0].definitions[4].exam: We waited for the lights to change.
The driver had failed to stop at a red light.
light.translation[0].definitions[5].defi: one of the lights on a car, bicycle etc that help you to see at night
light.translation[0].definitions[5].exam: He was dazzled by the lights of oncoming traffic.
light.translation[0].definitions[6].defi: an expression in someone’s eyes that shows an emotion or intention
light.translation[0].definitions[6].exam: There was a murderous light in his eyes.
light.translation[0].definitions[7].defi: a window in a roof or wall that allows light into a room
light.translation[0].note_box[0].section: The light was so bright he had to shut his eyes.
The white buildings reflected a blinding light.
Gradually her eyes became accustomed to the dim light.
Stand over here where the light is good.
The light was too poor for me to read.
the soft light of the candles
the cold light of the moon

The only natural light came from two high windows.

The light from the streetlamp shone through the curtains.
The only light came from the fire.
Light streamed in through the window.
The light fell on her book.
The light from the screen illuminated the people gathered round it.
the light produced by the sun
the gold circle of light cast by the lamp
Snow reflects a lot of light.
The fields and woods were bathed in golden light.
There was a shaft of light from the doorway.
A flash of light caught his attention.
They stood in the pool of light cast by the streetlamp.
light.translation[0].note_box[1].section: something that produces light, especially electric light, to help you to see
She switched the kitchen light on.
The lights in the house were all off.
an object that produces light by using electricity, oil, or gas – often used in names of lights
a lamp that you can carry, consisting of a metal container with glass sides that surrounds a flame or light
The miners used lanterns which were lit by candles.
a small electric lamp that you carry in your hand
We shone our torches around the cavern.
a stick of wax with a string through the middle, which you burn to give light
The restaurant was lit by candles.
the glass part of an electric light, that the light shines from
one of the two large lights at the front of a vehicle
It was getting dark so she switched the headlights on.
one of the two small lights next to the main lights, at the front and back of a car
one of the two red lights at the back of a vehicle
one of the lights on a car that flash to show which way the car is turning
light.translation[1].definitions[0].defi: a light colour is pale and not dark
light.translation[1].definitions[0].exam: You look nice in light colours.
I wanted a lighter yellow paint for the walls.
She had blue eyes and light brown hair.
light.translation[1].definitions[1].defi: a room that is light has plenty of light in it, especially from the sun
light.translation[1].definitions[1].exam: The kitchen was light and spacious.
The office was a big light room at the back of the house.
light.translation[1].definitions[2].exam: You can carry this bag – it’s fairly light.
You should wear light, comfortable shoes.
The truck was quite light and easy to drive.
She was as light as a feather (=very light) to carry.
light.translation[1].definitions[3].defi: if something is light, there is not very much of it or it is not very great
light.translation[1].definitions[3].exam: A light rain began to fall.
She was wearing only light make-up.
people who have suffered only light exposure to radiation
light.translation[1].definitions[4].defi: light clothes are thin and not very warm
light.translation[1].definitions[4].exam: She took a light sweater in case the evening was cool.
light.translation[1].definitions[5].defi: a light wind is blowing without much force
light.translation[1].definitions[5].exam: Leaves were blowing about in the light wind.
There was a light easterly breeze.
light.translation[1].definitions[6].defi: a light sound is very quiet
light.translation[1].definitions[6].exam: There was a light tap at the door.
Her voice was light and pleasant.
light.translation[1].definitions[7].defi: a light touch is gentle and soft
light.translation[1].definitions[7].exam: She gave him a light kiss on the cheek.
He felt a light tap on his shoulder.
light.translation[1].definitions[8].defi: light work is not hard or tiring
light.translation[1].definitions[8].exam: I found him some light work to do.
She only has a few light duties around the house.
The doctor has advised me to take regular light exercise.
light.translation[1].definitions[9].defi: food or drink that is light either does not have a strong taste or does not make you feel full very quickly, for example because it does not contain very much fat, sugar, or alcohol
light.translation[1].definitions[9].exam: We had a light white wine with the fish.
a new light cheese spread with virtually no fat
light.translation[1].definitions[10].def: a light meal is a small meal
light.translation[1].definitions[10].exa: I had a light lunch in town.
light.translation[1].definitions[11].def: food that is light contains a lot of air
light.translation[1].definitions[11].exa: a type of light, sweet bread
Beat the mixture until it is light and fluffy.
light.translation[1].definitions[12].def: a light punishment is not very severe
light.translation[1].definitions[13].def: not serious in meaning, style, or manner, and only intended to entertain people
light.translation[1].definitions[13].exa: His speech gradually became lighter in tone.
It’s a really good book if you want a bit of light reading.
The show looks at some of the lighter moments from the world of politics.
light.translation[1].definitions[14].def: light soil is easy to break into small pieces
light.translation[1].definitions[14].exa: Carrots grow well in light soils.
light.translation[2].definitions[0].defi: to start to burn, or to make something start to burn
light.translation[2].definitions[0].exam: He stopped to light a cigarette.
I lit the fire and poured a drink.
I couldn’t get the candles to light.
light.translation[2].definitions[1].defi: to provide light for a place
light.translation[2].definitions[1].exam: The porch is always well lit at night.
The kitchen was warm and brightly lit.
The room was lit by one large, central light.
light.translation[2].definitions[1].note: Light is usually passive in this meaning
light.translation[3].definitions[0].defi: light equipment, materials, machines etc are easily moved and used for fairly small tasks
light.translation[3].definitions[0].exam: The empty space will be converted for light industrial use.
light.translation[3].definitions[1].defi: when buying and selling of shares etc is light, very little business is being done on a financial market
light.translation[3].definitions[1].exam: Stocks fell for an eighth day in light trading.
light.translation[3].definitions[2].defi: if someone in authority uses a light touch, they trust the people or organizations they are in charge of and often let them make their own decisions
light.translation[3].definitions[2].exam: He ruled his staff with a light touch.
light.translation[4].definitions[0].defi: if you see something in a particular light, you think about it in a particular way
light.translation[4].definitions[0].exam: As long as the customer perceives the price and the product in a positive light, the extra price will be viable.
As rates rise in the money markets, equities may be seen in a less favourable light.
light.translation[4].definitions[1].defi: if something is decided in the light of something else, it is decided after taking that thing into consideration
light.translation[4].definitions[1].exam: Companies need to be satisfied that the contract is suitable in the light of their circumstances and financial position.
light.translation[4].definitions[2].defi: to approve a project, plan etc so that it can begin
light.translation[4].definitions[2].exam: The removal of investment controls gave the green light to financial institutions to invest in property.
